CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. 2 reads: "Residential 'Incinerator' - Merchants and residents in vicinity of the 6300 block of Flavel St., East Liberty, have been complaining for many weeks about this eyesore and violation of the smoke-control laws. The merchants say that despite their pleas to the City Complaint Bureau, police, fire and health authorities, nothing has been done about the nuisance, except to put out the fires which are started frequently to chase the vagrants, winos and loafers who hang around it.  Merchants say private rubbish haulers unload their trucks on this lot, then burn surplus refuse so that they can selvage metal parts and other items for sale as junk.  The nuisance has persisted all winter. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Empty lot with debris including wooden crates and bushel baskets, on 6300 block of Flavel Street, East Liberty, another version
